h: 108 killed in Road accidents in four months in rural Ekm
One killed, two injured in Road accident
25 people injured in Road accident after private bus rams into another in Kerala's Thrissur
sub_h: Over 25 people were injured after the collission of two private buses near Irinjalakuda in Thrissur district of Kerala on Tuesday morning. Two of the injured are said to be serious.

h: 3 of a family killed in Road accident, 2 injured in Kerala
sub_h: An elderly couple and their 11-year-old granddaughter were killed when their car collided head-on with a KSRTC bus at Thalikulam near Triprayar on Sunday morning.

h: 2 from Thrissur killed in Tamil Nadu Road accident
sub_h: Two persons from Thrissur - Lilly Varghese (63) of Nellikunnu and Jerald Jimmy (9) of Varantharapilli Pallikunnu - were killed when a tourist bus carrying them to Velankanni shrine overturned near Okkanadu in Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu, on Sunday morning.

h: Teenager killed in Road accident in Kochi
sub_h: An 18-year-old was killed in a Road accident at Puthiya Road on Willingdon Island on Monday night. The deceased has been identified as Ajmal Hamsa of Thankalam, Kothamangalam. The youth died after a car collided with his two-wheeler.

h: Elderly killed in Road accident in Kochi
sub_h: A 72-year-old two-wheeler rider died after being hit by a private bus at Judge's Avenue Junction near Kaloor on Saturday evening. The deceased has been identified as Rajagopal Naik of Kovilvattom Road. He died on the spot. The police have taken the driver of the bus operating between Fort Kochi and Aluva into custody. Naik leaves behind his wife and two daughters.

h: Rise in number of accidents involving bicycles in district
sub_h: The state capital of Thiruvananthapuram recorded 22 Road accidents involving bicycles in 2021. This number is significant because it is the first time that this has been reported in the city. The number of accidents in 2021 was lower than in 2020 and 2019, likely because of the Covid-19 lock-out. The report classifies accidents under various categories, and bicycle-related accidents are included under the category of accidents based on the type of impacting vehicle. Objects figures for 2021 show that all the 22 accidents involved grievous injuries to the people involved. Over the years, there has been a strong clamour to ensure safe cycling tracks on city roads, but due to lack of planning and space constraints, the demand has not been met yet. The minutes of one of the latest board meetings showed that smart city Thiruvananthapuram Limited and the city corporation were planning to revive the last mile connectivity scheme through public bicycle sharing in the city. The scheme is already functional in Kochi around 200 ebicycles are likely to be introduced in the city for the project. Public bicycle sharing was initially a part of the smart city proposal, but concerns were raised regarding the feasibility of the project. The main reason to put the project on hold was the difficulty in

h: Woman killed in two-wheeler accident
sub_h: A 40-year-old two-wheeler rider died in a Road accident in Irumbanam near Tripunithura on Thursday. The deceased was identified as Mary Sujin Malar, 40, wife of Sajan Murukeshan of Chitrapuzha. According to police, the twowheeler skidded by the edge of the road and the scooter overturned, she fell onto the road and got run over by a truck. Police initiated action against 9946 twowheeler riders for not wearing helmets in December as part of a special drive to improve road safety. They also booked 1173 motorists for not wearing seatbelts in the monthlong drive. They also took action against 643 drivers of public transport vehicles for not wearing correct uniforms, 362 for not having registration certificate of vehicles, 146 for driving without licence and 126 twowheeler riders for riding around with more than one pillion rider. 743 persons were booked for driving under influence.

h: 27-yr-old Navy officer killed in accident in Kochi
sub_h: A navy officer was killed in a Road accident in Fort Kochi on Sunday. The officer has been identified as Balasubramanyam from Tamil Nadu. The officer was travelling on his bike when a private bus collided with it. The driver and the bus have been taken into custody and a case is being registered against them.

h: 2 killed, 1 injured as truck rams 3 two-wheelers
sub_h: A woman and two men were killed when a truck crashed into three twowheelers in Kerala. The deceased have been identified as Lisa Anthony 38 of Panayikulam and Naseeb 35 of North Paravur. Raveendran 54 of North Paravur was also injured and was admitted to a private hospital. The incident happened around 1030am on Monday on the stretch between Cheranellore Signal and Varapuzha Bridge in front of an Indian Oil Petrol Pump. Lisa was on her scooter while Naseeb and Raveendran were on their bikes. There were no pillion riders on the three twowheelers the vehicles were headed towards Cheranellore and the truck was also heading in the same direction. One among the bikers was about to turn towards the petrol pump when the truck rammed all three vehicles.

h: Steep rise in accident cases, deaths in Thiruvananthapuram last year
sub_h: The state crime records bureau in Kerala has revealed that there has been an alarming rise in the number of accidents and deaths in the district in the past couple of years. In 2022, about 170 people lost their lives in around 1750 accidents. 107 people died in 2020 and that number rose to 112 and 170 in 2021 and 2022 respectively when it comes to traffic accidents. In 2018, there were 2129 accidents and 178 deaths, and in 2019, there were 1995 accidents and 177 deaths. However, the reason for the low accident death rates in 2020 could be the pandemic restrictions and lockdown, but gradually when the restrictions were lifted, there was a surge in the number of deaths and accidents. Meanwhile, the officials of the motor vehicle department opined that the active involvement of the department helped to reduce the number of s and deaths. When we take a look at the number of vehicles on the road in 2010 and in 2022, one can easily understand the fact that it has doubled. However, the number of accidents and deaths has not doubled after the pandemic restrictions were lifted. There was a gradual rise in the number of accidents and deaths, but it stands well below the figures before the pandemic. Motor vehicle inspector at the motor vehicle department said that the officials of the

h: Truck driver dies in Road accident
sub_h: A 39-year-old man was killed after the truck which he was driving overturned while negotiating a curve at Kalayanad in Kollam on Saturday. The deceased has been identified as Ganeshan, son of Izaki of Anna Nagar, Tirunelveli, Tamil Nadu.

h: Kerala home secretary V Venu, wife, son injured in Road accident
sub_h: Kerala home secretary V Venu, his wife Sarada Muraleedharan who is the additional chief secretary of the local-self government department, son Sabari, driver Abhilash and family friends - Pranav and Saurav - were injured in an accident near Kayamkulam in Alappuzha district in the wee hours of Monday.

h: NCRB: 41 killed in 2-wheeler accidents in Kochi last year
sub_h: Statistics of the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) for 2021 shows that in Kochi the most number of injuries due to Road accidents happened when the victims were travelling on two-wheelers.

h: Death of skater in Road accident flags safety concerns
sub_h: The tragic death of Sreekaryam native Rahul Krishnan, 24, while skating near Greenfield stadium, has raised questions regarding road safety again.

h: Chain snatcher killed in Road accident
sub_h: Two youths who were fleeing on a two-wheeler after snatching a golden chain of a woman at Thakkalai met with an accident at Pallichal near Naruvamoodu on Sunday. One among the youths was killed and the other got injured.

h: Five killed in separate Road accidents in Kerala
sub_h: As many as five people lost their lives in three separate accidents in Palakkad and Vadakara on Sunday. A couple was killed and four seriously injured in an accident when a tourist bus rammed a tempo traveller at Mangalam-Govindapuram state highway at Karipali, Mudappallur near Vadakkencherry on Sunday. The deceased couple, travelling in the tempo traveller, has been identified as Paily, 75, and his wife Rosli, 65, of Champakkad House, Arthungal, Cherthala.

h: Number of Road accidents on the rise in Ernakulam
sub_h: After a slight dip in the number of Road accidents in 2020 due to the pandemic-induced travel curbs, the number of accidents is again on the rise, shows the data of the state crime records bureau. As per the data, a total of 412 persons died in s in Ernakulam last year.

h: Chain snatcher dies in Road accident in Thiruvananthapuram
sub_h: A 17-year-old boy, an accused in a chain snatching case, died on Sunday when the bike he was riding crashed into a road divider on the national highway at Paroorkuzhi Pallichal near Naruvamoodu here, police said.

h: Fisherman killed in Road accident
sub_h: A 60-year-old fisherman died on Thursday after succumbing to injuries he suffered in a Road accident that occurred under Varkala police station limits on Wednesday afternoon. Nazeer, son of late Mammoor and Ramna of Vettoor is the deceased.

h: Ladakh Road accident: Malappuram native among seven killed
sub_h: An Indian Army soldier hailing from Parappanangadi in Malappuram is among the seven soldiers who lost their lives after the army vehicle they were travelling in skidded off the road and fell in Shyok River in Ladakh on Friday.

h: Two men die in Road accidents
Two people die in Road accidents
Thiruvananthapuram: Two men die in Road accidents
sub_h: Two men died in similar Road accidents that occurred on national highway under Kallambalam police station limits in a span of 12 hours.Kumar, 41, son of Kunjan of Manamboor died after he was knocked down by a trailer truck transporting brand new cars on Thursday night.

h: Three killed in Road accidents
Nurse killed in Road accident
Malayali nurses die in Saudi Road accident
sub_h: Two nurses, one from the district and one from Thiruvananthapuram, were killed in a Road accident in Saudi Arabia.

h: Kerala: Three youth killed in freak Road accident in Alappuzha
sub_h: In a freak accident, three youths died after the scooter they were riding on went out of control and rammed into an electric post late on Saturday at Venmony in Alappuzha.

h: Former Miss Kerala Ansi Kabeer, runner-up die in Road accident
sub_h: Former Miss Kerala and runner-up in the same competition were killed in a Road accident at Vyttila-Edappally bypass in Kochi on Monday morning.

h: Two dead in separate Road accidents in Kerala
sub_h: A woman died and her brother sustained injuries after their car collided with a truck on Saturday morning.

h: Five killed in car-lorry collision in Kerala; police probes mystery behind accident
sub_h: Mystery shrouds a car accident in which five people were killed near Ramanattukara in Kerala in the early hours of Monday with police detaining a few people who allegedly followed them in other vehicles. Five men were killed on the spot after the car in which they were travelling collided head-on with a fully- loaded lorry on the Kozhikode-Palakkad highway.

h: Kerala: Four die, one injured in Road accident at Karette
sub_h: Four persons were killed and another was injured in a Road accident at Karette, about 30 kilometres from Thiruvananthapuram on Monday.

h: Thiruvananthapuram tops in number of fatal accidents in Kerala
sub_h: As per the statistics released by the state crime records bureau, the capital district tops the list of most number of fatal accidents reported in the state in the last year. Thiruvananthapuram city and rural police districts have recorded a combined total of 348 fatal accident cases in which 367 individuals died. Of this, Thiruvananthapuram rural police district has contributed more than half the cases.

h: Covid fatalities surpass accident deaths in Kerala
sub_h: Deaths in the state from Road accidents and other communicable diseases were less than Covid-19-related fatalities in 2020. The overall death rate also dropped by around 10% between 2019 and 2020, as per latest data from the civil registration system.

h: Road accidents killed 372 in Ernakulam rural areas last year
sub_h: Ernakulam rural limits witnessed 372 deaths and 2,255 accidents last year till December, according to a report released by police. As many as 2,480 people were injured from road traffic crashes during the same period.

h: Two killed in Road accident in Ernakulam
Kozhikode: Newly-wed couple killed as bike collides with truck
sub_h: In a tragic incident, a newly-wed couple was killed in an accident on the national highway near Kakkanchery on Malappuram-Kozhikode border on Saturday.

h: Woman who tried to commit suicide dies in Road accident in Kerala's Alappuzha
sub_h: A 32-year-old-woman, who tried to commit suicide, died after the ambulance which was carrying her rammed a truck on NH-66 within Aroor police station limits. Her father and uncle also suffered injuries in the accident.

h: Kerala: Four dead as speeding bus rams into autorickshaw in Angamaly
sub_h: Four people, including three women of a family, died when the autorickshaw they were travelling in was hit by a private bus at Angamaly on Monday morning.

h: Two motorists killed in separate Road accidents
Father and son die in Road accident in Alappuzha
sub_h: A father and his son were killed in an accident on NH-66 in Alappuzha on Sunday after their two-wheeler got trapped between a truck and mini bus.

h: Two Kerala youths killed in Dubai Road accident
sub_h: Two youths, hailing from Kerala and were pursuing studies in foreign universities, died in a road accid1ent in Dubai on Thursday.

h: Kerala: On an average, lockdown saw 12 Road accidents each day
One death in Road accidents every day in Kochi
sub_h: As many as 1,246 persons were grievously injured and 106 persons were killed in Road accidents in Kochi till September this year, shows the latest data of the Kerala Police. The number of deaths in Rural Ernakulam is 249 whereas 2,321 persons sustained grievous injuries here this year.

h: 2 Kerala couples on vacation in Karnataka killed in road mishap
Kerala high court judge apologises to family of accident victim
More suicides in Kerala than Road accident deaths in 2018
sub_h: The suicide data of the state released by the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) along with the crime and accident data of 2018 presents a grim picture. In 2018, as many as 8,237 persons committed suicide in the state. This is nearly double the number of persons who died in s in the same year, which is 4,303. In 2017, the number of suicide deaths in the state were 7,870 and the year before, 7,705. While there was only an increase of 165 suicides going from 2016 and 2017, in 2018, there were 367 more suicides than the previous year.

h: Three killed in Road accident at Vythiri
Kerala tops in near-fatal accidents
sub_h: Kerala tops the chart when it comes to the number of people getting grievously injured in Road accidents and in 2018, the figure was 31,672, followed by Karnataka (21, 277). This was known from the latest data made available by the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH).

h: NRI on vacation killed in Road accident
